title: Boy, 17, shot in Claymont has died
content:
The 17-year-old boy who was shot Tuesday afternoon at Claymont's Stoneybrook Apartments has died, according to New Castle County police.
The boy, identified as Ismail Majid of the 200 block of Dewey Court, died about an hour after arriving at Nemours/Alfred I. duPont Hospital for Children, said Cpl. Tracey Duffy, a police spokeswoman. Investigators are currently not searching for a suspect, Duffy added.
"It's still under investigation, but we are not looking for anyone," she said.
Emergency responders were called to the Stoneybrook Apartments located in the 200 block of Dewey Court shortly before 1:30 p.m. Tuesday after reports of a possible shooting. Arriving officers found the teen with a gunshot wound to the upper torso.
Dispatchers had indicated via police scanner reports there was at least one person injured with a gunshot wound to the chest. He was later transported to Nemours/Alfred I. duPont Hospital for Children, Duffy said.
STORY: Boy, 17, injured in Claymont shooting

This is a developing story. Check back with delawareonline.com for more information.
